explanations.machine learning: The paper proposes a deep learning model for analyzing CBCT reports, which falls under the broader category of machine learning.
explanations.supervised learning: The model is trained on expert-annotated data, indicating a supervised learning approach.
explanations.classification: The model aims to classify oral lesions into high-risk and low-risk categories.
explanations.neural network: The proposed model is a deep learning model, which is a type of neural network.
explanations.deep learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of a deep learning model (CNN-LSTM) for analyzing textual reports.
explanations.representation learning: The model uses word embeddings to capture semantic similarities, which is a form of representation learning.
explanations.convolutional neural network: The model includes a CNN component for processing the data.
explanations.CNN: Abbreviation for convolutional neural network, which is part of the proposed model.
explanations.recurrent neural network: The model includes an LSTM component, which is a type of recurrent neural network.
explanations.long short-term memory: The model uses LSTM to process sequential data from the radiology reports.
explanations.LSTM: Abbreviation for long short-term memory, which is part of the proposed model.
